CalendarRange.name: showCalendar
CalendarRange.description: Allows to show or hide the calendar of the component

CalendarRange.name: showRanges
CalendarRange.description: Allows to pass or avoid the ranges to the component

CalendarRange.name: ranges
CalendarRange.description: Brings the list of ranges defined to the component

Collapse.name: className
Collapse.description: Class name attaced to dom element.

Collapse.name: in
Collapse.description: Show the component; triggers the enter or exit states

Collapse.name: addEndListener
Collapse.description:
Add a custom transition end trigger. Called with the transitioning DOM
node and a done callback. Allows for more fine grained transition end
logic. Note: Timeouts are still used as a fallback if provided.

Collapse.name: appear
Collapse.description:
Normally a component is not transitioned if it is shown when the
`<Transition>` component mounts. If you want to transition on the first
mount set  appear to true, and the component will transition in as soon
as the `<Transition>` mounts. Note: there are no specific "appear" states.
appear only adds an additional enter transition.

Collapse.name: mountOnEnter
Collapse.description:
By default the child component is mounted immediately along with the
parent Transition component. If you want to "lazy mount" the component on
the first `in={true}` you can set `mountOnEnter`. After the first enter
transition the component will stay mounted, even on "exited", unless you
also specify `unmountOnExit`.

Collapse.name: onEnter
Collapse.description:
Handler fired before the "entering" status is applied. An extra
parameter `isAppearing` is supplied to indicate if the enter stage is
occurring on the initial mount

Collapse.name: onEntering
Collapse.description:
Handler fired after the "entering" status is applied. An extra parameter
isAppearing is supplied to indicate if the enter stage is occurring on
the initial mount

Collapse.name: onEntered
Collapse.description:
Handler fired after the "entered" status is applied. An extra parameter
isAppearing is supplied to indicate if the enter stage is occurring on
the initial mount

Collapse.name: onExit
Collapse.description: Handler fired before the "exiting" status is applied.

Collapse.name: onExiting
Collapse.description: Handler fired after the "exiting" status is applied.

Collapse.name: onExited
Collapse.description: Handler fired after the "exited" status is applied.

Collapse.name: timeout
Collapse.type: number | { appear?: number | undefined; enter?: number | undefined; exit?: number | undefined; }
Collapse.description:
The duration of the transition, in milliseconds. Required unless addEndListener is provided.

You may specify a single timeout for all transitions:
```js
  timeout={500}
```
or individually:
```js
timeout={{
 appear: 500,
 enter: 300,
 exit: 500,
}}
```
- appear defaults to the value of `enter`
- enter defaults to `0`
- exit defaults to `0`

Collapse.name: unmountOnExit
Collapse.description:
By default the child component stays mounted after it reaches the
'exited' state. Set `unmountOnExit` if you'd prefer to unmount the
component after it finishes exiting.

The additional offset applied along the main axis between the element and its
anchor element.

Whether the element should flip its orientation (e.g. top to bottom or left to right) when
there is insufficient room for it to render completely.

no text will be displayed in the loading state

Combobox.description: Specifies the no results ui elements for the combobox

DataTable.description: Theme aware style object

DataTable.name: data
DataTable.description: The data used to populate the table.

DataTable.name: defaultColumn
DataTable.description: A default ColumnDef applied to all components in the table.

DataTable.name: columns
DataTable.description:
The column definition for the table.

Should follow the `@tanstack/react-table` [ColumnDef](https://tanstack.com/table/v8/docs/guide/column-defs)

DataTable.name: initialState
DataTable.description: The initial state of the table, can be set without controlling the state completely.

DataTable.name: isLoading
DataTable.description: Whether the table is currently loading data.

DataTable.name: enableExpandAll
DataTable.description: Whether the table supports expanding all table rows.

DataTable.name: enableExpanding
DataTable.description: Whether the table supports row expansion.

DataTable.name: enablePagination
DataTable.description: Whether the table supports pagination.

DataTable.name: enablePinning
DataTable.description: Whether the table supports pinned columns.

DataTable.name: enableMultiRowSelection
DataTable.description:
Whether to enable multiple row selection for all rows in the table.

Optionally pass in a function that given a row, returns whether to enable/disable row selection for the children in that row

DataTable.name: enableRowSelection
DataTable.description:
Whether to enable row selection for all rows in the table.

Optionally pass in a function that given a row, returns whether to enable/disable row selection for that row

DataTable.name: enableSelectAll
DataTable.description: Whether the table supports selecting all table rows.

DataTable.name: enableSorting
DataTable.description: Whether sorting is enabled for the table.

DataTable.name: enableSortingRemoval
DataTable.description: Whether the sort can removed from columns

DataTable.name: enableStickyHeader
DataTable.description: Whether the table header should stick when scrolling vertically

DataTable.name: expandAllButtonProps
DataTable.description: Props passed to the expand all button component

DataTable.name: expandButtonProps
DataTable.type: IconButtonProps | ((props: { table: DataTable<TData>; row: Row<TData>; }) => IconButtonProps)
DataTable.description: Props passed to the expand button component

DataTable.name: manualExpanding
DataTable.description: Whether the expanding state for the table is controlled.

DataTable.name: manualPagination
DataTable.description: Whether the pagination state for the table is controlled.

DataTable.name: manualSorting
DataTable.description: Whether the sorting state for the table is controlled.

DataTable.name: pageCount
DataTable.description: A total pageCount of the table (controlled).

DataTable.name: paginationProps
DataTable.description: Props passed to the pagination component

DataTable.name: rowCount
DataTable.description:
The total number of rows for the total table (controlled).

Used to display the total count in the table pagination

DataTable.name: selectCheckboxProps
DataTable.type: CheckboxProps<"label"> | ((props: { table: DataTable<TData>; row: Row<TData>; }) => CheckboxProps<"label">)
DataTable.description: Props passed to the select checkbox

DataTable.name: selectAllCheckboxProps
DataTable.description: Props passed to the select all checkbox

DataTable.name: state
DataTable.description: State object for the table (controlled).

DataTable.name: onExpandedChange
DataTable.description: Handler that is called on expanded change.

DataTable.name: onPaginationChange
DataTable.description: Handler that is called on pagination change.

DataTable.name: onRowSelectionChange
DataTable.description: Handler that is called on row selection change.

DataTable.name: onSortingChange
DataTable.description: Handler that is called on sort change.

Fade.name: className

Fade.name: in
Fade.description: Show the component; triggers the enter or exit states

Fade.name: addEndListener
Fade.description:
Add a custom transition end trigger. Called with the transitioning DOM
node and a done callback. Allows for more fine grained transition end
logic. Note: Timeouts are still used as a fallback if provided.

Fade.name: appear
Fade.description:
Normally a component is not transitioned if it is shown when the
`<Transition>` component mounts. If you want to transition on the first
mount set  appear to true, and the component will transition in as soon
as the `<Transition>` mounts. Note: there are no specific "appear" states.
appear only adds an additional enter transition.

Fade.name: mountOnEnter
Fade.description:
By default the child component is mounted immediately along with the
parent Transition component. If you want to "lazy mount" the component on
the first `in={true}` you can set `mountOnEnter`. After the first enter
transition the component will stay mounted, even on "exited", unless you
also specify `unmountOnExit`.

Fade.name: onEnter
Fade.description:
Handler fired before the "entering" status is applied. An extra
parameter `isAppearing` is supplied to indicate if the enter stage is
occurring on the initial mount

Fade.name: onEntering
Fade.description:
Handler fired after the "entering" status is applied. An extra parameter
isAppearing is supplied to indicate if the enter stage is occurring on
the initial mount

Fade.name: onEntered
Fade.description:
Handler fired after the "entered" status is applied. An extra parameter
isAppearing is supplied to indicate if the enter stage is occurring on
the initial mount

Fade.name: onExit
Fade.description: Handler fired before the "exiting" status is applied.

Fade.name: onExiting
Fade.description: Handler fired after the "exiting" status is applied.

Fade.name: onExited
Fade.description: Handler fired after the "exited" status is applied.

Fade.name: timeout
Fade.type: number | { appear?: number | undefined; enter?: number | undefined; exit?: number | undefined; }
Fade.description:
The duration of the transition, in milliseconds. Required unless addEndListener is provided.

You may specify a single timeout for all transitions:
```js
  timeout={500}
```
or individually:
```js
timeout={{
 appear: 500,
 enter: 300,
 exit: 500,
}}
```
- appear defaults to the value of `enter`
- enter defaults to `0`
- exit defaults to `0`

Fade.name: unmountOnExit
Fade.description:
By default the child component stays mounted after it reaches the
'exited' state. Set `unmountOnExit` if you'd prefer to unmount the
component after it finishes exiting.

Navigation.description: Whether the navigation is expanded by default (controlled).

Navigation.name: onOpenChange
Navigation.description: Handler that is called when the navigation's open state changes.

SideNavigationFooter.name: avatarProps
SideNavigationFooter.description: Props passed to the avatar component

SideNavigationFooter.name: title
SideNavigationFooter.description: The title of the footer menu

SideNavigationFooter.name: subTitle
SideNavigationFooter.description: The sub title of the footer menu

SideNavigationFooter.name: autoFocus
SideNavigationFooter.description: Whether the element should receive focus on render.

SideNavigationFooter.name: endIcon
SideNavigationFooter.description: Icon added after the button text.

SideNavigationFooter.name: href
SideNavigationFooter.description: A URL to link to if as="a".

SideNavigationFooter.name: excludeFromTabOrder
SideNavigationFooter.description:
Whether to exclude the element from the sequential tab order. If true,
the element will not be focusable via the keyboard by tabbing. This should
be avoided except in rare scenarios where an alternative means of accessing
the element or its functionality via the keyboard is available.

SideNavigationFooter.name: rel
SideNavigationFooter.description: The relationship between the linked resource and the current page. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/rel).

SideNavigationFooter.name: startIcon
SideNavigationFooter.description: Icon added before the button text.

SideNavigationFooter.name: target
SideNavigationFooter.description: The target window for the link.

SideNavigationFooter.name: type
SideNavigationFooter.description: The behavior of the button when used in an HTML form.

SideNavigationFooter.name: variant
SideNavigationFooter.description: The display variant of the button.

SideNavigationMenuGroup.name: defaultExpanded
SideNavigationMenuGroup.description: Whether the menu group is open by default (uncontrolled).

SideNavigationMenuGroup.name: iconProps
SideNavigationMenuGroup.description: Props pass to the end icon.

SideNavigationMenuGroup.name: isExpanded
SideNavigationMenuGroup.description: Whether the menu group is expanded by default (controlled).

SideNavigationMenuGroup.name: itemProps
SideNavigationMenuGroup.description: Props passed to the root menu item.

SideNavigationMenuGroup.name: label
SideNavigationMenuGroup.description: The text for the menu group label.

SideNavigationMenuGroup.name: labelProps
SideNavigationMenuGroup.description: Props passed to the label component.

SideNavigationMenuGroup.name: onExpandedChange
SideNavigationMenuGroup.description: Handler that is called when the menu group's open state changes.

SideNavigationMenuGroup.name: startIcon
SideNavigationMenuGroup.description: Icon added before the button text.

SideNavigationMenuItem.name: endIcon
SideNavigationMenuItem.description: Icon added after the item text.

SideNavigationMenuItem.name: isSelected
SideNavigationMenuItem.description: Whether the menu item is selected.

SideNavigationMenuItem.name: label
SideNavigationMenuItem.description: The text for the menu list label.

SideNavigationMenuItem.name: labelProps
SideNavigationMenuItem.description: Props passed to the label component.

SideNavigationMenuItem.name: startIcon
SideNavigationMenuItem.description: Icon added before the button text.

Skeleton.name: className
Skeleton.description: Classes to be applied to the root element

Table.name: isDense
Table.description: Visually compact vertical spacing. Defaults to false

TableCell.name: align
TableCell.description: Text alignment of the table cell.

TableColumn.name: align
TableColumn.description: Text alignment of the table column.

TableColumn.name: isActive
TableColumn.description: Whether the current column is actively sorted.

TableColumn.name: sortDirection
TableColumn.description: The sort direction of the column.

TableColumn.name: onClick
TableColumn.description: Callback executed on column click, used for column sort only.

Tag.name: isCopyable
Tag.description: Whether the tag supports click to copy

Tag.name: removeButtonProps
Tag.description: Props passed to the remove button.

TextArea.name: placeholder
TextArea.description: Temporary text that occupies the text input when it is empty.

TextArea.name: onChange
TextArea.description: Handler that is called when the value changes.

TextArea.name: endIcon
TextArea.description: Icon displayed at the end of the text field.

TextArea.name: helperText
TextArea.description: Helper text to append to the form control input element.

TextArea.name: helperTextProps
TextArea.description: Props passed to the helper text.

TextArea.name: inputRef
TextArea.description: The ref passed to the input element.

TextArea.name: inputProps
TextArea.description: Props passed to the input element.

TextArea.name: isReadOnly
TextArea.description: Whether the input can be selected but not changed by the user.

TextArea.name: isRequired
TextArea.description: Whether user input is required on the input before form submission.

TextArea.name: multiline
TextArea.description: Whether the textfield should support multiline input (textarea).

TextArea.name: startIcon
TextArea.description: Icon displayed at the start of the text field.

TextArea.name: validationState
TextArea.description: Whether the input should display its "valid" or "invalid" visual styling.

TextField.name: placeholder
TextField.description: Temporary text that occupies the text input when it is empty.

TextField.name: onChange
TextField.description: Handler that is called when the value changes.

TextField.name: endIcon
TextField.description: Icon displayed at the end of the text field.

TextField.name: helperText
TextField.description: Helper text to append to the form control input element.

TextField.name: helperTextProps
TextField.description: Props passed to the helper text.

TextField.name: inputRef
TextField.description: The ref passed to the input element.

TextField.name: inputProps
TextField.description: Props passed to the input element.

TextField.name: isReadOnly
TextField.description: Whether the input can be selected but not changed by the user.

TextField.name: isRequired
TextField.description: Whether user input is required on the input before form submission.

TextField.name: multiline
TextField.description: Whether the textfield should support multiline input (textarea).

TextField.name: startIcon
TextField.description: Icon displayed at the start of the text field.

TextField.name: validationState
TextField.description: Whether the input should display its "valid" or "invalid" visual styling.

Toaster.name: duration
Toaster.description: The length of time (in milliseconds) the toast is rendered.

Tooltip.name: defaultOpen
Tooltip.description: Whether the tooltip is open by default (uncontrolled).

Tooltip.name: delay
Tooltip.description: The delay time for the tooltip to show up.

Tooltip.name: isDisabled
Tooltip.description: Whether the tooltip should be disabled, independent from the trigger.

Tooltip.name: isOpen
Tooltip.description: Whether the tooltip is open by default (controlled).

Tooltip.name: offset
Tooltip.description:
The additional offset applied along the main axis between the element and its
anchor element.

Tooltip.name: onOpenChange
Tooltip.description: Handler that is called when the tooltip's open state changes.

Tooltip.name: placement
Tooltip.description: The placement of the element with respect to its anchor element.

Tooltip.name: title
Tooltip.description: The content rendered within the tooltip.

Tooltip.name: trigger
Tooltip.description: By default, opens for both focus and hover. Can be made to open only for focus.

Transition.name: addEndListener
Transition.description:
Add a custom transition end trigger. Called with the transitioning DOM
node and a done callback. Allows for more fine grained transition end
logic. Note: Timeouts are still used as a fallback if provided.

Transition.name: appear
Transition.description:
Normally a component is not transitioned if it is shown when the
`<Transition>` component mounts. If you want to transition on the first
mount set  appear to true, and the component will transition in as soon
as the `<Transition>` mounts. Note: there are no specific "appear" states.
appear only adds an additional enter transition.

Transition.name: children
Transition.type: string | number | boolean | ReactElement<any, string | JSXElementConstructor<any>> | ReactFragment | ReactPortal | ((status: TransitionStatus, props: Record<...>) => ReactNode)

Transition.name: className
Transition.description: Class name attaced to dom element.

Transition.name: in
Transition.description: Show the component; triggers the enter or exit states

Transition.name: mountOnEnter
Transition.description:
By default the child component is mounted immediately along with the
parent Transition component. If you want to "lazy mount" the component on
the first `in={true}` you can set `mountOnEnter`. After the first enter
transition the component will stay mounted, even on "exited", unless you
also specify `unmountOnExit`.

Transition.name: onEnter
Transition.description:
Handler fired before the "entering" status is applied. An extra
parameter `isAppearing` is supplied to indicate if the enter stage is
occurring on the initial mount

Transition.name: onEntering
Transition.description:
Handler fired after the "entering" status is applied. An extra parameter
isAppearing is supplied to indicate if the enter stage is occurring on
the initial mount

Transition.name: onEntered
Transition.description:
Handler fired after the "entered" status is applied. An extra parameter
isAppearing is supplied to indicate if the enter stage is occurring on
the initial mount

Transition.name: onExit
Transition.description: Handler fired before the "exiting" status is applied.

Transition.name: onExiting
Transition.description: Handler fired after the "exiting" status is applied.

Transition.name: onExited
Transition.description: Handler fired after the "exited" status is applied.

Transition.name: timeout
Transition.type: number | { appear?: number | undefined; enter?: number | undefined; exit?: number | undefined; }
Transition.description:
The duration of the transition, in milliseconds. Required unless addEndListener is provided.

You may specify a single timeout for all transitions:
```js
  timeout={500}
```
or individually:
```js
timeout={{
 appear: 500,
 enter: 300,
 exit: 500,
}}
```
- appear defaults to the value of `enter`
- enter defaults to `0`
- exit defaults to `0`

Transition.name: unmountOnExit
Transition.description:
By default the child component stays mounted after it reaches the
'exited' state. Set `unmountOnExit` if you'd prefer to unmount the
component after it finishes exiting.

Typography.name: variant
Typography.description: The display variant of the text.

VisuallyHidden.name: isFocusable
VisuallyHidden.description: Whether the element should become visible on focus, for example skip links.
